ACAT.Description: Reference Table for Acquisition Category (ACAT) values

AcquisitionMilestones.Description: Reference Table for the different Acquisition Milestones available

AuthorizingOfficialType.Description: Authorization Boundary Types as supplied by the Information Technology Categorization and Selection Checklist (ITCSC). Which AO organization the Program reports to.

Name.Comment: The type of Authorization Boundary. Ie, Aircraft, Space, etc.

InformationTechnologyType.Description: Reference Table for the different types of Information Technology (IT) designations

Subset.Comment: First level of categorization the AF Information Technology (IT) falls into. Ie, Information System, PIT, IT Services

Categorization.Comment: Secondary level of categorization the IT system falls into. Major Applications, Enclaves, PIT Products, Software

OperationalStatusType.Description: Reference Table of the different stages of operational usage a Program could be in

Country.Description: Reference Table for names of Countries

AlphaTwo.Comment: The Two letter Alpha 2 acronym for the country

AlphaThree.Comment: The Three letter Alpha 3 acronym for the country

State.Description: Reference Table for State names in the United States

Name.Comment: Long name of the state. Ie, Ohio

Name_Short.Comment: Short name of the state. Ie, OH

Country_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Country Table

Base.Description: Reference Table for US Military Bases

State_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the State Table

Country_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Country Table

Organization.Description: Reference Table of the different organizations found in the DoD. For example this could be Malcoms or Divisions or Program Offices. They are logical collections of groups of people that represent a core unit.

Creation_Date.Comment: When this Organization was added to the Reference Table

Base_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Base Table which represents where the Organization is headquarted

Parent_ID.Comment: The immediately overarching organization (parent) to this organization. This would be the Division to a Branch, for example.

Description.Comment: Description of the organization and who they represent or their mission.

RDTE_Type.Description: Reference Table for Research, Development, Test and Evaluation (RDT&E) zone types

Name.Comment: Name of the RDT&E zone type.

SystemProtectionLevel.Description: Insert with correct definition of what the System Protection Level means

Name.Comment: Name of the System Protection Level

Description.Comment: Description of what the System Protection Level entails.

ProgramDtl.Description: Information and details regarding a Program

ITIPS_Number.Comment: Information Technology Investment Portfolio System (ITIPS) Number assigned by SAF.

System_Purpose.Comment: Overall objective aimed at servicing by the Program

DITPR_Number.Comment: Department of Defense Information Technology Portfolio Repository (DITPR) number assigned to Program.

AFID_Number.Comment: Unique identifier given to SAP programs to account for them in an anonymous manner

EMASS_Number.Comment: Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (EMASS) assigned identification number

AuthorizingOfficialType_ID.Comment: Reference Key to Authorizing Official Type Table

ACAT_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the ACAT Table

IT_Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the IT Type reference table

RDTE_Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the RDTE Type reference table

OperationalStatus_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Operational Status Type Table

Organization_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Organization Table

SystemProtectionLevel_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Protection Level Table

ForeignUsers.Comment: Boolean for whether there are any Foreign National Users associated with the Program

UserFullDataAccess.Comment: Boolean for whether all users have formal access for all data with the Program

Created_Date.Comment: When the program row was created

Modified_Date.Comment: When the program was last modified

Previous_ID.Comment: Foreign key to the previous Program ID

ProgramDtl_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the ProgramDtl table

Parent_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table. This is used to capture if there are multiple Programs that belong to a larger, overarching, Program.

AuthorizationBoundary.Description: An imaginary boundary containing all components of a system that will be authorized for operation by an authorizing official. The Authorization Boundary for a particular system excludes separately authorized systems, even if the systems are connected.

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table

BasisOfEstimate.Description: Lookup Table for a Basis of Estimate that relates to a specific Program

Modified_Date.Comment: When the BOE was last modified

Previous_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the previous BOE this element relates to

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program table

Organization_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Organization Table for the company that proposed the BOE

BasisOfEstimatesDtl.Description: Details of the proposed items found within a Basis of Estimate

Description.Comment: Text description of the BOE item

BOE_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the BOE Table

PII_PHI_Types.Description: Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and Personal Health Information (PHI) values as defined by CNSSSI 1253F, attachment 6

CNSS_Questionaire.Description: CNSS Overlay Questions as found in the Information Technology Categorization and Security Checklist (ITCSC)

CrossDomain.Comment: Will you implement, manage, or maintain a Cross Domain Solution? (CNSSI 1253F Attachment 3)

ISR.Comment: Does the system process, store, or transmit ISR? (CNSSI 1253F Attachment 4)

Classified_Processed.Comment: Does the system store, process, or transmit classified information? (CNSSI 1253F Attachment 5)

NC3.Comment: Does the system store, process or transmit Nuclear Command and Control (NC3) data?

Space.Comment: Is the system (or subsystem) a space platform as defined in CNSSP No. 1253 and unmanned? CNSSI 1253F Attachment 2

Mission.Comment: Is your system required to execute a mission or function-special overlay? (e.g. Financial, Acquisition)

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Program Table

Joint_Organization.Description: Reference Tables of all different Joint Organizations

Country_Owned.Comment: Boolean for whether a country owns this classification

Group_Owned.Comment: Boolean for whether a Joint group owns this classification

CountryOfOwnership.Comment: Foreign Key to the Country Table

GroupOfOwnership.Comment: Foreign Key to the JointOrganization Table

ConnectionType.Description: Reference Table for types of connections between systems. Ie LAN, RS-232, Bluetooth

Name.Comment: Name of the connection type. Ie, Bluetooth, RS-232

Wireless.Comment: Boolean of whether the connection is wireless or not. 1 = True, 0 = False

CriticalProgramInformation.Description: Critical Program Information (CPI) found within a Program

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table

Creation_Date.Comment: When the information was declared CPI.

MissionType.Description: Common Mission Types that are found amongst many different programs. Can include things like Aviate, Navigate, Maintenance, etc

Description.Comment: Description of what the Mission Type entails

Mission.Description: A Mission represents a specific objective or task, irrespective of its scale or scope, assigned to or undertaken by an individual, team, unit, or organization. This includes a wide range of activities, from high-level strategic operations to specific, tactical-level tasks. The term is used in a generic sense to encompass various types of assignments, operations, exercises, or endeavors, traditionally referred to as missions, operations, tasks, functions, or submissions.

Description.Comment: Description of what the mission entails

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign key to the Program table

Safety_Critical_Function.Comment: If this (sub)Mission a Safety Critical Function

Mission_Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MissionType Table

CriticalitySource.Description: Lookup Table for all the different sources of analysis of Criticality Values

Reference_Location.Comment: Reference to the external location where the Analysis report is held

Conducting_Organization_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Branch_Squadron Table. Ie, which organization oversaw the Analysis.

ImpactValue.Description: Reference Table for the different options of Impact values. Ie, Very High, VH, 5

Short_Name.Comment: Short name for the value. Ie, VH

Numeric_Value.Comment: Numeric value for the rating. Ie, 5.

Long_Name.Comment: Long Name for the value. Ie, Very High

Criticality.Description: Look up table for Criticality values that relate to a specific Component for a Program. *Update with formal definition*

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table

Mission_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Mission Table

Source_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Criticality Source Table

Value_ID.Comment: Foreign key to the Impact Value Reference

MITRE_TACTIC.Description: Tactics represent the why of an ATT&CK technique or sub-technique. It is the adversary\

MITRE_ATTACK_Impact_Types.Description: Denotes if the (sub-)technique can be used for integrity or availability attacks

Revoked.Comment: Boolean for whether the Technique has been revoked

Depreciated.Comment: Boolean for whether the Technique has been deprecated

Detection.Comment: How to Detect for this Technique on a System

Remote_Support.Comment: Boolean for if the (sub-)technique can invoke an instance of itself remotely without relying on external tools/techniques

System_Requirements.Comment: Additional information on requirements the adversary needs to meet or about the state of the system (software, patch level, etc.) that may be required for the (sub-)technique to work

Version.Comment: Version Number of the Technique object

Impact_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Impact Type Reference table

Parent_Technique.Comment: If this Technique is a Subtechnique, then the Foreign Key to the Parent Technique

Superseded_By.Comment: If the Technique is superseded, a foreign key to the Technique that supersedes it.

InterfaceType.Description: Reference Table for the Type of Interfaces. Ie USB, Bluetooth, LAN etc

Wireless.Comment: Boolean of whether the interface type is wireless or not. 1 = True, 0 = False

InterfaceRestrictionType.Description: Reference Table for the different types of restrictions an interface port can have on it.

Type.Comment: Description of restriction type on an interface port. Ie, None, Physical, Software, etc.

Name.Comment: Name of the encryption type. Ie, SHA-256

SystemType.Description: Reference Table for the common different types of System groupings or cateogories. Ie, Radio, Data Bus, Radar, Aircraft, Network Switch, etc

System.Description: A system can be any element identified within the authorization boundary. This schema does delineate a system from a subsystem. All subsystems are classified as systems with an associated parent system to show that it is a subsystem.

Acronym.Comment: Acronym for the name of the System

ExternalEntity.Comment: Boolean of whether the System does not fall under the control of, and is external to, the Authorization Boundary

ImageReference.Comment: Reference Location to image of the System

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table

AuthorizationBoundary_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Authorization Boundary Table

DAR_Encryption_Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Encryption Table if there is Data At Rest (DAR)

Supplier_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Organization Table for who the Supplier is

Parent_ID.Comment: If this system is a subsystem then the foreign key to the parent system. Same logic for component to subsystems.

SystemType_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the SystemType Table

Interface.Description: An Interface establishes a point of communication between two systems. A USB port on blade computer could be identified as an interface for example.

System_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Table

InterfaceType_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Interface Type Table

RestrictionType_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Interface Restriction Type Table

Parent_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Parent Interface if this Interface is a child object. Ie, a pin on a larger port.

Name.Comment: Reference name for the interface, if applicable.

WheelOfAccess.Description: Reference Table for the Intelligence Communitys (IC) Wheel of Access

Major_Category.Comment: Name of the Major Category of the Wheel of Access

Minor_Category.Comment: Name of the Minor Category of the Wheel of Access

Description.Comment: Description for the Minor Category to include common tactics

CyberAttack.Description: Lookup Table of Cyber Attacks and the possible related MITRE ATTACK data

Time_Frame.Comment: Description of when the Cyber Attack would be executed

Possible_Outcome.Comment: Description of what the expected outcome of the Cyber Attack would be

Interface_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Interface Table of where the Attack would penetrate through, if applicable.

ATTACK_Tactic_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Tactic Table

ATTACK_Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Technique Table

System_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Table

Wheel_Of_Access_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Wheel Of Access Table that most accurately categorized the attack

IntelligenceConfidenceValue.Description: Reference Table for the different options of Likelihood Confidence values. Ie, Very High, VH, 5

Long_Name.Comment: Long Name for the value. Ie, Very High

Short_Name.Comment: Short name for the value. Ie, VH

Numeric_Value.Comment: Numeric value for the rating. Ie, 5.

IntelligenceRatingValue.Description: Reference Table for the different options of Intelligence Rating values for Intent and Capability. Ie, Very High, VH, 5

Long_Name.Comment: Long name for the value. Ie, Very High

Short_Name.Comment: Short name for the value. Ie, VH

Numeric_Value.Comment: Numeric value for the rating. Ie, 5.

IntelligenceProduct.Description: Lookup Table for different Intelligence Products

Reference_Location.Comment: Reference to the external location where the Report is held

Conducting_Organization_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Branch_Squadron Table. Ie, which organization oversaw the Product.

IntelligenceFusion.Description: Lookup table of Fusion Products created by the Intelligence Community (IC)

Country_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Country Table

Intent_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Intelligence Rating Values Table

Intent_Conf_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Intelligence Confidence Values Table

Capability_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Intelligence Rating Values Table

Capability_Conf_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Intelligence Confidence Values Table

Source_ID.Comment: Foreign key to the Intelligence Product table

LikelihoodValue.Description: Reference Table for the different options of Likelihood values. Ie, Very High, VH, 5

Long_Name.Comment: Long Name for the value. Ie, Very High

Short_Name.Comment: Short name for the value. Ie, VH

Numeric_Value.Comment: Numeric value for the rating. Ie, 5.

Means.Description: Lookup Table for Means values that relate to a specific vulnerability. *Update with formal definition*

Fusion_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Intelligence Fusion Table

Value.Comment: Foreign Key to the Likelihood Value Reference Table

Opportunity.Description: Lookup Table for Opportunity values that relate to a specific vulnerability. *Update with formal definition*

Fusion_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Intelligence Fusion Table

Value.Comment: Foreign Key to the Likelihood Value Reference Table

SeveritySource.Description: Lookup Table for the different sources of analysis of Severity Values

Reference_Location.Comment: Reference to the external location where the Analysis report is held

Conducting_Organization_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Branch_Squadron Table. Ie, which organization oversaw the Analysis.

Severity.Description: Look up table for Severity values that relate to a specific vulnerability. *Update with formal definition*

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table

Source_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Severity Source Table

Value_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Impact Value Table

Risk.Description: Lookup Table for Risks belonging to a Program

Active.Comment: Boolean of whether the Risk is still active

Created_Date.Comment: When the Risk was first recorded

Modified_Date.Comment: When the Risk was modified last

Risk_Value.Comment: Risk rating before mitigations are implemented. Generated from combining Severity/Criticality/Means/Opportunity with the RiskRating Table

Risk_Mitigated_Value.Comment: Risk rating after mitigations are implemented. Generated from combining Severity/Criticality/Means/Opportunity with the RiskRating Table

Previous_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the previous Risk ID

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Program Table

Severity_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Severity Table

Criticality_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Criticality Table

Opportunity_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Opportunity Table

Means_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Means Table

CyberAttack_Path.Description: Lookup Table of the different Cyber Attack Path Steps that would occur throughout a Cyber Attack

Name.Comment: Name of the Cyber Attack Path

Tested.Comment: Boolean of whether the Cyber Attack has been tested for validity

Tested_Date.Comment: If the Cyber Attack Path was tested, date of occurrence

Path_Possible.Comment: If the Cyber Attack Path was tested, boolean if the attack could be successfully completed.

Risk_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Cyber Risk Table that this Cyber Attack Path relates to

CyberAttack_Path_Step.Description: The individual steps of occurrence throughout the entirety of a Cyber Attack

Previous_Attack_ID.Comment: If this step occurs after the completion of a previous step in the attack path, foreign key to that Step ID

CAP_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Cyber Attack Path Table

Attack_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Cyber Attack Table

SoftwareType.Description: Distinguishes the categorization of the software, i.e. Firmware, Operating System, etc.

Software.Description: Software details for software/firmware found in the system.

Version.Comment: Version of the Software being used

Supplier_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Organization Table for who the Software Supplier is

Software_Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Software Type Table

VulnerabilitySource.Description: Lookup Table for all the different sources of analyses for vulnerability identification

Name.Comment: Reference Name for the Vulnerability Source

Reference_Location.Comment: Reference to the external location where the Analysis report is held

Conducting_Organization_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Branch_Squadron Table. Ie, which organization oversaw the Analysis.

Vulnerability.Description: Lookup Table for Vulnerabilities belonging to a Program. Vulnerabilities can pertain to Systems or Software and are referenced from either non-compliant Security Controls or from outside Vulnerability Identification analyses

Description.Comment: Description of the Vulnerability. Also known as the Vulnerability statement.

Vulnerability_Source_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Vulnerability Source Table

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table

System_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Table

Software_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Software Table

WheelOfAccess_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Wheel of Access Table

CyberAttack_Vulnerabilities.Description: Connecting Table of Vulnerabilities that would be exploited as part of a Cyber Attack

CyberAttack_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Cyber Attack Table

Vulnerability_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Vulnerability Table

Organization_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Organization Table for which Oranization the User belongs to

Created_Date.Comment: When this User object was created.

Modified_Date.Comment: When this User object was last modified.

DurationType.Description: Reference Table for the different units of time. Ie, Day, Month, etc

Long.Comment: Long spelling of the duration. Ie, day, week, month, year

Short.Comment: Abbreviation of the duration. Ie, day, wk, mth, yr

CyberAuthorizationType.Description: Reference table of all the different type of Cyber Authorizations exist

CyberAuthorization.Description: Cyber Authorizations for Programs along with their expiration dates

Duration.Comment: Numerical length of the Cyber Authorizations duration.

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table

Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Cyber Authorization Type Table

Duration_Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Duration Type Table

AuthorizingOffical_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Authorizing Official who owns the authorization

ApprovalDate.Comment: Date of when the Cyber Authorization was approved

ExpirationDate.Comment: Date of when the Cyber Authorization will expire

DataType.Description: Reference Table for the different types of Data. Ie, Imagery, Maintenance, Navigation etc

Name.Comment: The category of data type. Ie, Imagery, Maintenance, etc.

Division_Group.Description: Details of an acquisition Division or Group organization

Name.Comment: Name of the Division or Group

Creation_Date.Comment: When this Division or Group was added to the Reference Table

Modified_Date.Comment: When this Division or Group had updates last made

Base_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Base Table

Acronym.Comment: Acronym for the Division or Group

FunctionalType.Description: Reference Table of all the functionals that can be found in a Program. Ie, Cyber, Test, Program Protection, Finance

Name.Comment: Name of the functional. Ie, Cyber, Test, Engineering

MITRE_ATTACK_Collection_Layers.Description: A description of where the data source may be physically collected (ex: Host, Network, Cloud Control Plane, etc.)

MITRE_ATTACK_Defenses.Description: Reference Table of defensive tools, methodologies, and processes

Name.Comment: Name of the Defensive tool, methodology, or process

MITRE_ATTACK_Platforms.Description: Reference Table of Operating Systems and Applications

Is_Operating_System.Comment: Boolean for whether the Platform is a Operating System. True for Operating System, False for Application

MITRE_Data_Sources.Description: Data sources represent the various subjects/topics of information that can be collected by sensors/logs. Data sources also include data components, which identify specific properties/values of a data source relevant to detecting a given ATT&CK technique or sub-technique.

Version.Comment: Version Number of this Data Source Object

MITRE_Data_Component.Description: Specific properties/values of a data source relevant to detecting a given ATT&CK technique or sub-technique.

Version.Comment: Version Number of the Data Component

Data_Source_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Data Sources Table

MITRE_Data_Source_Reference.Description: External References belonging to MITRE ATTACK Data Sources

Reference_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE_External_References Table

Data_Source_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Data Source Table

MITRE_Data_Sources_Collection_Layers.Description: Connecting Table between MITRE Data Sources and the MITRE ATTACK Collection Layers

Data_Source_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Data Source Table

Layer_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Collection Layers reference table

MITRE_Data_Sources_Platforms.Description: MITRE ATT&CK Platforms which are the system an adversary is operating within. Could be an operating system or application

Data_Source_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Data Source Table

Platform_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITE ATTACK Platforms Table

MITRE_Group.Description: Groups are sets of related intrusion activity that are tracked by a common name in the security community. Analysts track clusters of activities using various analytic methodologies and terms such as threat groups, activity groups, threat actors, intrusion sets, and campaigns. Some groups have multiple names associated with similar activities due to various organizations tracking similar activities by different names. Organizations\

Revoked.Comment: Boolean for whether the Group was revoked

Depreciated.Comment: Boolean for whether the Group has been depreciated

Version_Number.Comment: Version Number for the Group object

Superseded_By.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Group object that supersedes this object, if available.

MITRE_GROUP_Aliases.Description: Names that have overlapping reference to a group entry and may refer to the same or similar group in threat intelligence reporting

Group_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Group Table

MITRE_Malware.Description: Commercial, custom closed source, or open source software intended to be used for malicious purposes by adversaries. Examples include PlugX, CHOPSTICK, etc.

Depreciated.Comment: Boolean for whether the Malware has been depreciated

Version_Number.Comment: Version Number for this Malware object

Superseded_By.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Malware object that supersedes this object, if available.

MITRE_Group_Malware.Description: Connecting Table of the MITRE ATTACK Malware that have been used by specific Groups

Group_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Group Table

Malware_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Malware Table

MITRE_Group_Technique.Description: Connecting Table of the MITRE ATTACK Techniques that have been used by specific Groups

Group_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Group Table

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Technique Table

MITRE_TOOL.Description: Commercial, open-source, built-in, or publicly available software that could be used by a defender, pen tester, red teamer, or an adversary. This category includes both software that generally is not found on an enterprise system as well as software generally available as part of an operating system that is already present in an environment. Examples include PsExec, Metasploit, Mimikatz, as well as Windows utilities such as Net, netstat, Tasklist, etc.

MITRE_Group_Tool.Description: Connecting Table of the MITRE ATTACK Tools that have been used by specific Groups

Group_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Group Table

Tool_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Tool Table

MITRE_Group_References.Description: External References belonging to MITRE ATTACK Groups

Reference_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE_External_References Table

Group_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Group Table

MITRE_MALWARE_Aliases.Description: Names that have overlapping reference to a software entry and may refer to the same or similar software in threat intelligence reporting

Malware_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Malware Table

MITRE_Malware_Technique.Description: Connecting Table of the MITRE ATTACK Technique that are used as part of Malware

Malware_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Malware Table

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Technique Table

MITRE_Mitigation.Description: Mitigations represent security concepts and classes of technologies that can be used to prevent a technique or sub-technique from being successfully executed.

Depreciated.Comment: Boolean for whether this Mitigation is depreciated

Version.Comment: Version Number for this Mitigation Object

Created_Date.Comment: When this Mitigation object was created

Modified_Date.Comment: When this Mitigation object was last modified

Mitigation_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Mitigation Table

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Technique Table

MITRE_Malware_Platforms.Description: MITRE ATT&CK Platforms which are the system an malware is operating within. Could be an operating system or application

Malware_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Malware Table

Platform_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Platforms Table

MITRE_Malware_References.Description: External References belonging to MITRE ATTACK Malware

Reference_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE_External_References Table

Malware_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Malware Table

MITRE_Mitigation_References.Description: External References belonging to MITRE ATTACK Mitigations

Reference_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE_External_References Table

Mitigation_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Mitigation Table

MITRE_Technique_Data_Component.Description: Connecting table for the Data Components that can detect MITRE ATTACK Techniques

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Technique Table

Data_Component_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Data Components Table

MITRE_Technique_Defense_Bypasses.Description: Connecting Table of all the Defenses that particular Techniques bypass

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Technique Table

Defense_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Defenses Reference Table

System_Permissions.Description: Reference Table of Permission Types that can be found on Systems. Ie, Administrator, root, etc.

MITRE_Technique_Obtained_Permissions.Description: The level of permissions the adversary will attain by performing the (sub-)technique

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the ATTACK Technique Table

Permission_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Permissions reference Table

MITRE_TECHNIQUE_References.Description: External References belonging to MITRE ATTACK Techniques

Reference_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE_External_References Table

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Technique Table

MITRE_Technique_Required_Permissions.Description: The lowest level of permissions the adversary is required to be operating within to perform the (sub-)technique on a system.

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Technique Table

Permission_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Permissions reference Table

MITRE_Technique_Tactics.Description: Connecting Table for Tactic objectives that (sub-)techniques can be used to accomplish

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Technique Table

Tactic_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Tactics Table

MITRE_TOOL_Aliases.Description: Names that have overlapping reference to a software entry and may refer to the same or similar software in threat intelligence reporting

Tool_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Tool Table

MITRE_Tool_Technique.Description: Connecting Table of the MITRE ATTACK Technique that are used as part of a Tool

Tool_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Tool Table

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Technique Table

MITRE_Tactic_References.Description: External References belonging to MITRE ATTACK Tactics

Tactic_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Tactic Table

MITRE_Techniques_Platforms.Description: MITRE ATT&CK Platforms which are the system an adversary is operating within. Could be an operating system or application

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Technique Table

Platform_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Platform Table

MITRE_Tool_Platforms.Description: Connecting Table for MITRE Tools and Platforms

Platform_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Platforms Table

MITRE_Tool_References.Description: External References belonging to MITRE ATTACK Tools

Reference_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE_External_References Table

Tool_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Tool Table

MemoryType.Description: Reference Table for the different formats that memory can be stored. Ie, RAM, EEPROM

Name.Comment: Name of the memory Type. Ie, Random Access Memory

Acroynm.Comment: Acronym for the memory type. Ie, RAM.

Volatile.Comment: Whether this memory type stores in Non Volatile manner. 1= Volatile, 0 = Nonvolatile

MemorySizeType.Description: Reference Table for the different sizes memory could be referenced in. Ie, Gig or Megabyte

Short_Name.Comment: Short name, or acronym, for the size. Ie, Gb

Long_Name.Comment: Long name for the memory size. Ie, Gigabyte

Units.Comment: How many powers of 10 the size is.

Memory.Description: Details for a memory source found on a System, Subsystem, or Component

Size.Comment: Numeric Value for how much memory is available

Removable.Comment: Binary for whether the memory source is removable

Size_Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Memory Size Type Table

Memory_Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Memory Type Table

MissionLocation.Description: Lookup Table of location(s) for different Missions

Base_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Base Table

State_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the State Table

Country_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Country Table

UserType.Description: Reference Table for Types of Users. Ie Pilots, Maintainers, ISSMs etc

Name.Comment: Name of the User Type. Ie, ISSM, Maintainer, Pilot, etc.

Functional_ID.Comment: Foreign key to the Functional Type Table

MissionUserRequirements.Description: Information on the Users required as part of a specific Mission

Count.Comment: Number of users of a specific type required for a given mission

Clearance_Required.Comment: Foreign key to the Classification Type table

Mitigation.Description: Mitigations that are used to remove or reduce Risks

Technical.Comment: Boolean of whether this mitigation is technical in nature. Ie, 1 = Technical, 0 = Administrative.

Estimated_Cost.Comment: Estimated cost value for the mitigation to be completed

Actual_Cost.Comment: Actual realized cost of the mitigation to be implemented

Implemented.Comment: Boolean of whether the mitigation has been completed yet

Project_Implementation_Date.Comment: Projected date of when the mitigation will be implemented.

Actual_Implementation_Date.Comment: Date of when the mitigation was actually implemented.

Created_Date.Comment: When this mitigation was first identified

Modified_Date.Comment: When this mitigation was last modified

Previous_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the previous mitigation ID

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table

Risk_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Risk Table

NSS_Questionaire.Description: Table of questions to define whether the system is a National Security System (NSS)

Intel.Comment: Does the function, operation, or use of the system involve intelligence activities

Crypto.Comment: Does the function, operation, or user of the system involve cryptologic activities related to national security

Command_Control.Comment: Does the function, operation, or use of the system involve military command and control of military forces

Weapon.Comment: Does the function, operation, or use of the system involve equipment that is an integral part of the weapon or weapons system

Business.Comment: If the use of the system is not a routine administrative or business application, is the system critical to the direct fulfillment of military or intelligence missions

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program table

NistSecurityControlFamily.Description: Reference Table of the families, or categories, of the NIST 800-53 Security Controls

Abbreviation.Comment: Short hand notation for the family

Name.Comment: Name of the security control family

NistSecurityControls.Description: Reference Table of the NIST 800-53 Security Controls by each revision

Discussion.Comment: Discussion and elaboration of the Control

Family_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Control Family

NistControlRelation.Description: Reference Table for the NIST 800 53 Security Controls and their related controls

Primary_Control_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the primary control

Related_Control_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the related control

OperationalView.Description: Reference Table of the different Operational Views available

Description.Comment: Description of what the OV is designed to depict

SecurityControlOverlay.Description: Reference Table of all Security Control Overlays

OfficePrimaryResponsibility_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Oranization Table for who the Office of Primary Responsibility for the Overlay is.

Acronym.Comment: Acronym of the Security Control Overlay, if applicable.

OverlayControls.Description: Reference Table for NIST 800-53 Security Controls that belong to Overlays

SecurityControlOverlay.Comment: Foreign Key to the Security Control Overlay Table

NIST_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the NIST Security Controls Table

ProgramAcquisitionMilestones.Description: Lookup Table for all the Milestones a Program has undergone

Projected_Date.Comment: Date of when the Milestone is expected to begin

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Program Table

Milestone_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Acquisition Milestone Table

ProgramOperationalView.Description: Lookup Table for the Operational View (OV) diagrams for a Program

ReferenceLocation.Comment: Reference to location of where OV is being stored

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Program Table

OV_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Operational View Table

ProgramSecurityControlOverlay.Description: Lookup Table of Security Control overlays that pertain to a Program.

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Program Table

SecurityControlOverlay_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Security Control Overlay Table

ProgramSecurityControls.Description: Tracking of all the NIST security controls related to a Program and their compliancy metrics

Applicable.Comment: Boolean for whether the control was deemed applicable to the Program

Compliant.Comment: Boolean for whether the Program is compliant with the control

Discussion.Comment: Description of how the program is or is not compliant with the control or why the control is not applicable

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Program Table

ProgramUser.Description: Information on the individuals related to the Program

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign key to the Program Table

User_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the User Table

UserType_ID.Comment: Foreign key to the UserType table

User_Title.Comment: Title of the User in reference to the Program. Ie, ISSM, SCA, Program Protection Lead

Description.Comment: Description of the Requirement that needs to be met

Reference_Document.Comment: Reference location of document that mandates the requirement

Reference_Document_Identifier.Comment: Unique identifier to requirement found in the Reference Document

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table

SecurityClassificationGuide.Description: Lookup table of Security Classification Guides

Name.Comment: Name of the Security Classification Guide

Version.Comment: Version of the Security Classification Guide

Created_Date.Comment: When the Security Classification Guide was initially created

Modified_Date.Comment: When the Security Classification Guide was last updated

Previous_ID.Comment: If the Security Classification Guide was updated, a Foreign Key to the last version

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program that this Security Classification Guide belongs to

Parent_ID.Comment: If Security Classification Guide has an overarching guide, then a reference to said classification guide.

VerificationType.Description: Reference Table for the different forms of verification events

Name.Comment: Name for the Verification event type. Ie, Inspection, analysis, interview, etc.

SoftwareTestingType.Description: Reference Table for the different types of Software Testing that can be completed

Name.Comment: Name of the software testing type

Verification_Type.Comment: Foreign Key to Verification Type Table

SoftwareTest.Description: Lookup Table for the software tests that have taken place on a given piece of software

TestingType_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to Software Testing Type Table

StatementOfWork.Description: Lookup Table for the Statement of Work (SOW) relating to a Program

Reference_Location.Comment: Reference to the location of where the SOW is being stored

Modified_Date.Comment: When the SOW was last modified

Previous_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the previous SOW ID

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table

StatementOfWorkItemType.Description: Reference Table for the type of activity the SOW item covers. Ie, Data Delivery, Software Scan, etc

Description.Comment: Description of the Statement of Work activity type

Functional_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Functional reference Table

StatementOfWorkItem.Description: Details regarding specific line items and activities found within a Statement of Work

SOW_Reference_Number.Comment: Reference Number to where this line item is found in the SOW

Text.Comment: The text excerpt of the line item or activity found in the referenced SOW

StatementOfWork_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Statement of Work Table

Functional_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Functional Table

SOW_ItemType_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the SOW Item Type reference table

StatementOfWorkResult.Description: The success or failure of SOW line items with discussions of how the statement could be improved on for future contracts.

Success_Rating.Comment: Numeric rating (0-1) of how successful the SOW item was at achieving the desired result when it was first written. 0 = Not successful, 1 = Perfectly executed

Discussion.Comment: Discussion of how the SOW item resulted contractually and, if it resulted poorly, what the points of contention were

SOW_Item_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Statement of Work Item Table

SystemConnection.Description: Identifies details about the connections between systems.

Parent_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Connection table if this connection is a child object. Ie, a data line on a data bus

ConnectionType_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Connection Type Table

Encryption_Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Encryption Table

Interface_1_ID.Comment: Interface in the connection belonging to the First System

Interface_2_ID.Comment: Interface in the connection belonging to the Second System

System_1_ID.Comment: First referenced System in the connection

System_2_ID.Comment: Second referenced System in the connection

ClassificationStatement.Description: Full classification statements that include the Dissemination and Control Caveats

Name.Comment: Spelled out classification statement. Ie, CUI//NOFORN

OperationalData.Description: A data type that supports the mission(s) and â€˜physicallyâ€™ run across system lines. Data types can also belong to an overarching data type, for example Precise Participant Location and Identification (PPLI) messages are an operational data type that can fall under the overarching operational data type of J-Series Messages, which can fall under the overarching operational data type of Link-16 data.

Parent_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Operational Data if this is a subset piece of data

Data_Description.Comment: Description of what the data piece entails

Data_Type_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Data Type Table

Classification_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the ClassificationStatement table. This is used to get all the classifications, disseminations, and control handling caveats for a unique piece of operational data.

SystemConnectionData.Description: Identifies details about the data transferred between systems through system connections.

System_Connection_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Connection Table

Operational_Data_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Operation Data Table

Source_System_ID.Comment: The System in the System Connection that is sending the designated Data

Target_System_ID.Comment: The System in the System Connection that is receiving the designated Data

SystemRequirements.Description: Connecting Table Between Systems and their Requirements

System_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Table

Requirement_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Requirement Table

SystemSecurityControls.Description: Tracking of all the NIST security controls related to a System and their compliancy metrics

Applicable.Comment: Boolean for whether the control was deemed applicable to the system

Compliant.Comment: Boolean for whether the System is compliant with the control

Discussion.Comment: Description of how the system is or is not compliant with the control or why the control is not applicable

Confidentiality.Description: Reference Table for Confidentiality which is defined as preserving authorized restrictions on information access and disclosure, including means for protecting privacy and proprietary information.

Name.Comment: Name of the value. Ie, Low

Acronym.Comment: Acronym for the value. Ie, L

Description.Comment: Description for what the loss of Confidentiality means

Numeric_Value.Comment: Numerical representation of the Confidentiality value. Ie, 1

Integrity.Description: Reference Table for Integrity which is defined as guarding data against improper modification or destruction and includes information nonrepudiation and authenticity.

Name.Comment: Name of the value. Ie, Low

Acronym.Comment: Acronym for the value. Ie, L

Description.Comment: Description for what the loss of Integrity means

Numeric_Value.Comment: Numerical representation of the Integrity value. Ie, 1

Availability.Description: Reference Table for Availability which is defined as timely and reliable access to and use of data.

Name.Comment: Name of the value. Ie, Low

Acronym.Comment: Acronym for the value. Ie, L

Description.Comment: Description for what the loss of Availability means

Numeric_Value.Comment: Numerical representation of the Integrity value. Ie, 1

SystemData.Description: Lookup Table of all the Operational Data that is either Stored, Transmitted, or Processed by a System

System_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Table

Operational_Data_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Operational Data Table

MissionData.Description: Defined as the data needed to support each unique mission. Mission data can be utilized for multiple missions.

Mission_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Mission Table

Operational_Data_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Operational Data Table

Required.Comment: 1 or 0 for whether this data is required input to the mission. 1 = True, 0 = False ie data is an outproduct of the Mission

Confidentiality_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Confidentiality Reference Table

Integrity_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Integrity Reference Table

Availability_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Availability Reference Table

CIA_Justification.Comment: Justification statement explaining the reasoning to the CIA values. This supports Information Technology Categorization and Security Checklist.

SCG_Operational_Data.Description: Connecting table of all the Operational Data found in a Security Classification Guide

Security_Classification_Guide_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the SecurityClassificationGuide Table

Operational_Data_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the OperationalData Table

Joint_Organization_Membership.Description: Lookup Table for all the countries that belong to a joint group

Joint_Org_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the JointOrganization Table

Country_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Country Table

Programmatic_Data.Description: Lookup table of all the programmatic details pertaining to a program. Consider this as facts about a program that one might find in an SCG.

Program_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Program Table.

Classification_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the ClassificationStatement table. This connection is used to get all the classifications, disseminations, and control handling caveats for a particular piece of programmatic data.

SCG_Programmatic_Data.Description: Connecting Table of all the Programmatic Data found within an SCG

Security_Classification_Guide_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the SCG Table

Programmatic_Data_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Programmatic Data Table

Dissemination.Description: Reference Table of different types of Disseminations

PID.Comment: Boolean for whether this Dissemination is a PID

CodeName.Comment: If this Dissemination is a PID, then this is the value of it.

Classification_Control_Caveats.Description: Reference Table of all the different Information Protection controls.

Name.Comment: Name of the Information Protection Control

Acronym.Comment: Acronym of the Information Protection Control

Parent_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Information Protection control if this is a child control

Programmatic_Data_Releasability_Country.Description: Connecting Table for Programmatic Data and the Countries that it is releasable to

Programmatic_Data_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Programmatic Data Table

Country_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Country Table

Operational_Data_Releasability_Country.Description: Connecting Table for Operational Data and the Countries that it is releasable to

Operational_Data_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Operational Data Table

Country_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Country Table

Programmatic_Data_Releasability_Group.Description: Connecting Table for Programmatic Data and the Joint Organizations that it is releasable to

Programmatic_Data_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Programmatic Data Table

Group_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Joint Group Table

Operational_Data_Releasability_Group.Description: Connecting Table for Operational Data and the Joint Organizations that it is releasable to

Operational_Data_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Operational Data Table

Group_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Joint Group Table

First_Seen.Comment: When the Campaign was first seen

Last_Seen.Comment: When the Campaign was last seen

Created_Date.Comment: When this Campaign was first created

Modified_Date.Comment: When this Campaign was last modified

Revoked.Comment: Boolean whether this Campaign has been revoked

Deprecated.Comment: Boolean whether this Campaign has been depreciated

MITRE_Campaign_References.Description: External References belonging to MITRE ATTACK Groups

Reference_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE_External_References Table

Campaign_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Group Table

MITRE_Campaign_Aliases.Description: Names that have overlapping reference to a group entry and may refer to the same or similar group in threat intelligence reporting

Campaign_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Group Table

MITRE_Campaign_Malware.Description: A connecting table for Malware that a Campaign Uses.

Campaign_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Campaign Table

Malware_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Attack Malware Table

MITRE_Campaign_Group.Description: Connecting table for the Groups associated with Campaigns..

Campaign_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Campaign Table

Group_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Attack Group Table

MITRE_Campaign_Tool.Description: A connecting table for the Tools that a Campaign Uses.

Campaign_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Campaign Table

Tool_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Attack Tool Table

MITRE_Campaign_Technique.Description: A Connecting Table for the Techniques a Campaign Uses.

Campaign_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE ATTACK Campaign Table.

Technique_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the MITRE Attack Technique Table

Entry_Point.Description: Entry Points are fictitious points where data crosses the authorization boundary. Each unique data exchange between systems that crosses the authorization boundary is numbered for tracking purposes.

System_Connection_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to System Connection Table to represent which system connection crossing a boundary this Entry Point belongs to

Text.Comment: Name or Number Identifier for the Entry Point

AuthorizationBoundary_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Authorization Boundary Table to show which boundary the Entry Point belongs to

SystemCollection.Description: System Collections are somewhat like Authorization Boundary but in a non cyber sense. Ie, side mirrors and rear view mirror belong to mirror collection but they do not have a distinct authorization boundary.. This is for a logic collection not for a physical collection

SystemCollection_Elements.Description: Connecting table for a System Collection and the Systems that are part of it

SystemCollection_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Collection Table

System_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System Table

MissionHierarchy.Description: Mission hierarchy is used to establish relationships between missions. A mission can have multiple parent missions that it supports.

Parent_Mission.Comment: Foreign Key to the parent Mission in this hierarchal relationship

Child_Mission.Comment: Foreign Key to the child Mission in this hierarchal relationship

ClassificationStatement_Classification.Description: Connecting Table between the ClassificationStatement table and the ClassificationType table. Establishes all the classifications that make up a single classification statement.

ClassificationStatement_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the ClassificationStatement table

ClassificationType_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the ClassificationType table

ClassificationStatement_Dissemination.Description: Connecting Table between the ClassificationStatement table and the Dissemination table. Establishes all the disseminations that make up a single classification statement.

ClassificationStatement_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the ClassificationStatement table

Dissemination_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Dissemination table

ClassificationStatement_ControlCaveat.Description: Connecting Table between the ClassificationStatement table and the Classification_Control_Caveat table. Establishes all the classification caveats that make up a single classification statement.

ClassificationStatement_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the ClassificationStatement table

ControlCaveat_ID.Comment: Foriegn Key to the Classification_Control_Caveat table

AuthorizationBoundary_Collection.Description: Hierarchal relationships between authorization boundaries that can consist of multiple authorization boundaries.

Parent_ID.Comment: Foreign key to the authorization boundary that holds the parent position in this hierarchal relationship

Child_ID.Comment: Foreign key to the authorization boundary that holds the children position in this hierarchal relationship

SystemSoftware.Description: Connecting table that shows what Software resides on or is used by given systems.

System_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the System under consideration

Software_ID.Comment: Foreign Key to the Software under consideration
